dataModel.title: Prototype Veg Plots Database Component Description: userDefined
dataModel.author: J. Harris
dataModel.description: This table stores the linkage between a plot observation and a user defined value.

entity.entitySummary: This table stores the linkage between a plot observation and a user defined value.
entity.entityDescription: As with the notation related tables, the table structure of the user defined values stems from the desire to keep the user defined values seperate from the bulk of the plots database. This structure basically allows the user to define attributes and store information in those attributes that can be associated with a given plot observation. Moreover, the user can designate a catagory for each of their user defined attribites in order to associate the data with a specific type including: environmental, vegetation, reference related and party oriented.

attribute.attDefinition: Primary key for the userDefined table.
Name of the used defined element.
This attribute stores metadata about this user defined attribute.

This is the category for the association between the plot observation and the user defined attribute stored in this table. Business rules will lock the vocabulary used in this column to specific categories such as environmental and vegetation.
Database data type of the user defined element.

Name of table that this element is most closely associated with, an attribute that will be infered by the interface tools. For example soilColor may be an attribute defined by the user an would be associated with the plot table.
